item.title: Old vs New John Deere Tractors
item.description: A clear comparison between older and newer John Deere models, highlighting differences in features, comfort, and performance while showing how each fits into daily farm work.

media:content.media:title: Old vs New John Deere Tractors
media:content.media:description: A clear comparison between older and newer John Deere models, highlighting differences in features, comfort, and performance while showing how each fits into daily farm work.

item.title: This Combine Is Really Old
item.description: A look at an aging combine still being put to work, highlighting its features, how it runs, and the role older equipment can still play in everyday farm tasks.

item.title: Will Our Old John Deere Start Again?
item.description: A look at trying to start an older John Deere, highlighting its condition, the steps taken, and the satisfaction of seeing classic equipment come back to life on the farm.

item.title: A Look at a Remote-Controlled Tractor
item.description: Exploring a tractor that can be operated by remote control, highlighting how the technology works and what it can do in everyday farm tasks.

item.title: This Tractor Feels Old to Me
item.description: A light, honest look at a tractor that feels old compared to today’s machines, highlighting its features, how it handles, and its place in daily farm work.

item.title: Harvesting Corn With 59-Year-Old Equipment
item.description: A look at harvesting corn using decades-old farm equipment, highlighting how well-kept machines can still handle the job and offer a cost-effective way to work in the field.

item.title: Surrounded by Corn in the Field
item.description: A light look at working in tall corn, highlighting the view from the field and the daily tasks that come with harvest season.

item.title: Ready to Wrap Up the Day on the Farm
item.description: A relatable look at the final stretch of a long farm day, highlighting the work, the pace, and the feeling of nearing the finish after hours in the field.

item.title: Ridging and Cultivating Across the Fields
item.description: A look at ridging and cultivating through the fields, highlighting the equipment, steady progress, and a few moments that come up along the way during a full day of farm work.

item.title: This Is How We Do It on the Farm
item.description: A clear look at the steps and teamwork behind a typical task on the farm, showing how daily work gets done efficiently and safely.

item.title: Restoring Old Equipment for 1960s-Style Farming
item.description: A look at bringing vintage farm equipment back to working order, highlighting the restoration process, classic machinery, and the satisfaction of using older tools in today’s fieldwork.

item.title: A Day Spent Cutting Soybeans
item.description: A look at a full day of cutting soybeans, highlighting field conditions, equipment in action, and the steady pace of harvest on the farm.

item.title: He Can Do Whatever He Wants on the Farm
item.description: A light farm-life moment highlighting the independence and personality that come with daily tasks around the operation, keeping the tone friendly and down-to-earth.

item.title: Exploring A Dry Riverbed
item.description: Laura heads out to walk through a dry riverbed, taking a closer look at the terrain and what remains when the water is gone.

item.title: Our Four Wheeler Broke!
item.description: The four-wheeler suddenly gives out, and Laura takes a look to figure out what went wrong and how to get it running again.

item.title: Oh No! I Spilled the Beans!
item.description: While working in the field, Laura accidentally spills beans from the hopper and shows how she cleans up the mess and keeps the day moving.

item.title: We Are Helping Them Out!
item.description: Laura heads over with the tractor to lend a hand to the neighbors, helping them tackle a task and get their fieldwork back on track.

item.title: Driving the Tractor Without Auto Steer
item.description: A hands-on look at driving the tractor manually. See how straight, steady, and smooth the work can be without relying on auto steer.

item.title: I’m So Excited Today
item.description: I'm So Excited!

item.title: Helping a Stuck Car with the Tractor
item.description: A car gets stuck, and the tractor steps in to help. A straightforward look at how the situation is handled safely and efficiently on the farm.
